paper_title: Construction of In<sub>2</sub>S<sub>3</sub>@NH<sub>2</sub>-MIL-68(In)@In<sub>2</sub>S<sub>3</sub> Sandwich Homologous Heterojunction for Efficient CO<sub>2</sub> Photoreduction

result.query: What is the chemical name of the catalyst used in the experiment?

evidences.pdf_reference: 456 gas chromatograph (GC) equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID) using a methanizer and a GC9790 Plus gas chromatograph (GC) equipped with a TCD were utilized to analyze the gas products. 2.4.Photoreduction Procedure.The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reaction was evaluated in an airtight glass reactor with a quartz top cap and a gas sampling port.Typically, 10 mg of photocatalyst, 45 mg of bipyridine (bpy), 60 L of CoCl 2 aqueous solution (54.6 mM), and 6 mL of the mixed reaction solution (V CH 3 CN /V TEOA 4:1) were mixed in a reactor.Then, the reactor was evacuated, and was purged
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. The GC is equipped with a FID detector.
2. The GC is equipped with a methanizer.
3. The GC9790 Plus instrument is equipped with a TCD detector.
4. The GC9790 Plus instrument is equipped with a FID detector.
5. CO 2 undergoes a photocatalytic reduction reaction.
6. Bipyridine (bpy) is mixed with a solution containing 45 mg of substance.
7. CoCl 2 forms an aqueous solution with a concentration of 54.6 mM.
8. CH 3 CN is mixed with a solution containing V units of substance.
9. TEOA is mixed with a solution containing V units of substance.
10. The photocatalyst is part of the reactor mixture, present in quantities of 10 mg.
11. The mixed reaction solution is part of the reactor mixture, present in quantities of 6 mL.
12. The GC9790 Plus instrument has a quartz top cap.
13. The GC9790 Plus instrument has a gas sampling port.

evidences.pdf_reference: (V CH 3 CN /V TEOA 4:1) were mixed in a reactor.Then, the reactor was evacuated, and was purged with high purity CO 2 at a partial pressure of 0.1 MPa.This process was carried out several times to ensure that the reactor was full of pure CO 2 .The solution was irradiated with a 300 W xenon lamp (420 nm) with 400 mW cm -2 of light intensity (10.5 cm distance from the reaction solution).During irradiation, the reaction system was stirred and kept at a temperature of 15 C with a condenser circulation pump.The generated products were quantified every 2 h by a flame ionization detector (FID).
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts: 
1. The reactor was evacuated.
2. The reactor was purged.
3. The reactor was filled with CO2.
4. TEOA was mixed with V CH 3 CN.
5. The reactor was irradiated with light from a Xenon lamp.
6. Light intensity was applied to the reaction solution.
7. Distance was set at 10.5 cm from the reaction solution.
8. Temperature was maintained at 15°C.
9. A condenser circulation pump was used for cooling.
10. A flame ionization detector (FID) was used to quantify products.
11. The reactor was stirred during irradiation.
12. The Xenon lamp emitted light with an intensity of 400 mW/cm².
13. V CH 3 CN was mixed in a reactor.
14. TEOA was used as a catalyst or reagent.
15. CO2 was purged into the reactor.

Inferred Facts:
16. V CH 3 CN reacted with TEOA.
17. V TEOA was used in the reaction.

evidences.pdf_reference: Photocatalytic conversion of CO 2 into fuel and value-added chemicals as a promising method has been applied recently to ease energy-or environment-related crises.Herein, we construct an In 2 S 3 NH 2 -MIL-68(In) In 2 S 3 (denoted as SMS(In)) sandwich homologous heterojunction via a controllable in situ metal-organic frameworks (MOF) sulfuration process.The improved photoreduction activity mainly lies in the effective charge transfer and separation through a homogeneous interface, enhanced CO 2 adsorption and mass transfer, and plentiful reactive sites.Benefiting from this unique hollow
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. CO2 is adsorbed by In2S3NH2-MIL-68(In).
2. In2S3NH2-MIL-68(In) has improved photoreduction activity.
3. SMS(In) benefits from a homogeneous interface.
4. MOF is sulfured by the in situ metal-organic frameworks process.
5. CO2 is Carbon Dioxide.
6. Energy relates to environment.
7. Environment relates to energy.
8. Fuel is a value-added chemical.
9. Chemicals are fuel.
10. In2S3NH2-MIL-68(In) is a compound.
11. MIL-68 is a metal-organic framework.
12. SMS(In) has plentiful reactive sites.
13. MOF is a Metal-Organic Framework.

evidences.pdf_reference:
Article_Title
Construction of In<sub>2</sub>S<sub>3</sub>@NH<sub>2</sub>-MIL-68(In)@In<sub>2</sub>S<sub>3</sub> Sandwich Homologous Heterojunction for Efficient CO<sub>2</sub> Photoreduction
Abstract
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. InS3 is composed of NH2.
2. MIL-68(In) consists of Indium.
3. CO2 can be reduced by In2S3-NH2-MIL-68(In)@In2S3.
4. NH2 is part of In2S3-NH2-MIL-68(In)@In2S3.

evidences.pdf_reference: spectroscopy was performed with Bruker VERTEX 70.The morphologies and elemental composition were characterized by a field-emission scanning electron microscope (FESEM, HITACHI UHR FESEM SU8200) and a transmission electron microscope (TEM, PHILIPS TECNAI 10), respectively.CO 2 adsorption isotherms were collected on Micromeritics ASAP 2020.The products were degassed under vacuum conditions at 150 C for 6 h before measuring the CO 2 adsorption at 298 K. UV-vis diffused reflectance spectra (DRS) was measured by a UV-vis spectrophotometer (U-3900, HITACHI, Japan).The steadystate and transient
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. Spectroscopy was performed with Bruker VERTEX 70.
2. Morphologies and elemental composition were characterized by a field-emission scanning electron microscope (FESEM).
3. Morphologies and elemental composition were characterized by a HITACHI UHR FESEM SU8200.
4. Elemental composition was characterized by a PHILIPS TECNAI 10.
5. CO2 adsorption isotherms were collected on Micromeritics ASAP 2020.
6. Products were degassed under vacuum conditions at 150 C for 6 h before measuring the CO2 adsorption.
7. CO2 adsorption was measured at 298 K.
8. UV-vis diffused reflectance spectra (DRS) were measured by a UV-vis spectrophotometer.
9. Steadystate and transient refer to the states of the system.
10. Temperature (150 C) and 298 K are related to vacuum conditions.
11. Steadystate and transient refer to the states of CO2 adsorption isotherms.
12. Morphologies and elemental composition are related to the characterization process.
13. Adsorption refers to the CO2 adsorption isotherms.
14. Diffused reflectance spectra (DRS) refer to UV-vis spectrophotometer measurements.

Note: Relations 9, 11, and 12 have implicit relationships that can be inferred from the given triples but are not explicitly stated in the format of triples.

evidences.generated_facts:
Let's construct some simple fact sentences using the provided relationships.

Since we're working with a single entity, I'll use the first option: (Experimental, is, ). This implies that Experimental is a thing or concept that exists on its own.

Here are a few examples of fact sentences:

1. The experimental process is ongoing.
2. Experimental methods have been used in various fields.
3. The term "experimental" refers to a type of scientific inquiry.

Now, let's try the second option: (Experimental, related to, ). This implies that Experimental has some connection or association with something else.

Here are a few examples of fact sentences:

1. Experimental results often require statistical analysis.
2. The experimental approach is distinct from traditional methods.
3. Experimental design plays a crucial role in scientific research.

Please let me know if you'd like to explore more relationships or provide additional context!

evidences.pdf_reference: spectroscopy was performed with Bruker VERTEX 70.The morphologies and elemental composition were characterized by a field-emission scanning electron microscope (FESEM, HITACHI UHR FESEM SU8200) and a transmission electron microscope (TEM, PHILIPS TECNAI 10), respectively.CO 2 adsorption isotherms were collected on Micromeritics ASAP 2020.The products were degassed under vacuum conditions at 150 C for 6 h before measuring the CO 2 adsorption at 298 K. result.query: From the choices provided, which reactor type is used in the experiment?

evidences.pdf_reference: (V CH 3 CN /V TEOA 4:1) were mixed in a reactor.Then, the reactor was evacuated, and was purged with high purity CO 2 at a partial pressure of 0.1 MPa.This process was carried out several times to ensure that the reactor was full of pure CO 2 .The solution was irradiated with a 300 W xenon lamp (420 nm) with 400 mW cm -2 of light intensity (10.5 cm distance from the reaction solution).During irradiation, the reaction system was stirred and kept at a temperature of 15 C with a condenser circulation pump.The generated products were quantified every 2 h by a flame ionization detector (FID).
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts: 
1. The reactor was evacuated.
2. The reactor was purged.
3. The reactor was filled with CO2.
4. TEOA was mixed with V CH 3 CN.
5. The reactor was irradiated with light from a Xenon lamp.
6. Light intensity was applied to the reaction solution.
7. Distance was set at 10.5 cm from the reaction solution.
8. Temperature was maintained at 15°C.
9. A condenser circulation pump was used for cooling.
10. A flame ionization detector (FID) was used to quantify products.
11. The reactor was stirred during irradiation.
12. The Xenon lamp emitted light with an intensity of 400 mW/cm².
13. V CH 3 CN was mixed in a reactor.
14. TEOA was used as a catalyst or reagent.
15. CO2 was purged into the reactor.

Inferred Facts:
16. V CH 3 CN reacted with TEOA.
17. V TEOA was used in the reaction.
